wpm.controller

Class PageEditController

  • java.lang.Object
    • wpm.controller.PageEditController

  • public class PageEditController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides event programmed responses to workspace interactions for this application for things like adding elements, removing elements, and editing them.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PageEditController(WebPageMaker initApp)
      Constructor for initializing this object, it will keep the app for later.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void enable(boolean enableSetting)
      This mutator method lets us enable or disable this controller.
      void handleAddElementRequest(HTMLTagPrototype element)
      This function responds to when the user tries to add an element to the tree being edited.
      void handleAttributeUpdate(HTMLTagPrototype selectedTag, java.lang.String attributeName, java.lang.String attributeValue)
      This function responds live to the user typing changes into a text field for updating element attributes.
      void handleCSSEditing(java.lang.String cssContent)
      This function provides a response to when the user changes the CSS content.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • PageEditController

        public PageEditController(WebPageMaker initApp)
        Constructor for initializing this object, it will keep the app for later.
        Parameters:
        initApp - The JavaFX application this controller is associated with.

    • Method Detail

      • enable

        public void enable(boolean enableSetting)
        This mutator method lets us enable or disable this controller.
        Parameters:
        enableSetting - If false, this controller will not respond to workspace editing. If true, it will.

      • handleAttributeUpdate

        public void handleAttributeUpdate(HTMLTagPrototype selectedTag,
                                  java.lang.String attributeName,
                                  java.lang.String attributeValue)
        This function responds live to the user typing changes into a text field for updating element attributes. It will respond by updating the appropriate data and then forcing an update of the temp site and its display.
        Parameters:
        selectedTag - The element in the DOM (our tree) that's currently selected and therefore is currently having its attribute updated.
        attributeName - The name of the attribute for the element that is currently being updated.
        attributeValue - The new value for the attribute that is being updated.

      • handleAddElementRequest

        public void handleAddElementRequest(HTMLTagPrototype element)
        This function responds to when the user tries to add an element to the tree being edited.
        Parameters:
        element - The element to add to the tree.

      • handleCSSEditing

        public void handleCSSEditing(java.lang.String cssContent)
        This function provides a response to when the user changes the CSS content. It responds but updating the data manager with the new CSS text, and by exporting the CSS to the temp css file.
        Parameters:
        cssContent - The css content.
